description: From Middle English lipnen (“to trust”), of obscure origin. Perhaps an alteration of Middle English litnen (“to trust”), of North Germanic origin, from Old Norse hlíta, compare Swedish lita (“to trust, depend, rely on”).

verbs.description: lippen (third-person singular simple present lippens, present participle lippening, simple past and past participle lippened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK dialectal, Northern England, Scotland) To entrust; trust to (someone/something).
(intransitive, UK dialectal, Northern England, Scotland) To trust; to expect; to depend or rely (on).
examples: Do not lippen to him! / I was lippening on you.
